messages.subject: Re: Yamamoto Tatewaki
messages.msgSnippet: Yes, there is actually a photo of him. I posted it in the SHQ s Shinsengumi and Related People section of the Photos section. I ve also just posted under
messages.messageBody:
Yes, there is actually a photo of him. I posted it in the SHQ's
"Shinsengumi and Related People" section of the "Photos" section.

I've also just posted under this groups "Illustrations", a picture of
a cavalry officer. It's an image I've had in my head for quite some
time now...I know this sounds weird, but I feel like I was there.

--M.

messages.subject: Re: Yamamoto Tatewaki
messages.msgSnippet: M. is there a photo of Yamamoto Tatewaki or this from your imagination? Good work as always from someone who can actually write their names in Japanese:)
messages.messageBody:
M. is there a photo of Yamamoto Tatewaki or this from your imagination?
Good work as always from someone who can actually write their names in
Japanese:)

--- In SHQ_Spy_Division@yahoogroups.com, "Shimazu Masayoshi"
<patriot014@h...> wrote:
> Just posted in "Illustrations"-- Yamamoto Tatewaki, general of the
> Nagaoka forces, who fought to the last, and past the fall of his
> domain, having been beheaded in Aizu (during the siege/battle) on
> September 9, 1868.
>
> --M.

messages.subject: Yamamoto Tatewaki
messages.msgSnippet: Just posted in Illustrations -- Yamamoto Tatewaki, general of the Nagaoka forces, who fought to the last, and past the fall of his domain, having been
messages.messageBody:
Just posted in "Illustrations"-- Yamamoto Tatewaki, general of the
Nagaoka forces, who fought to the last, and past the fall of his
domain, having been beheaded in Aizu (during the siege/battle) on
September 9, 1868.

--M.
